title: A Study of theme and technique in Amy Lowell's poems
abstract: This thesis is an analysis of amy Lowell's poems . ln trying to understand more about the values of human 's life that Lowell qets Trom her experiences , the writer of this thesis decides to study the themes and techniques in Lowell's poems . The research , therefore , deals with two areas which are goinq to be carefully clarified. Firsk , the study is focused on the element of theme such as love , pain , passion and beauty of nature as they are exgressed in Lowell's poems . The study also discusses the techniques which Lowell uses in her poems . The techniques consist of the use of imaqe as proposed by the lmagists , polyphonic prose that Lowell derives from the conventional methods of poetry , and figurative language . The writer of this thesis is interesked in doinq a study on this topic since she is impressed by Miss Lowell's memorable poems . When the writer of this thesis reads each poem more than twice , she finds her self more excited . Therefore , she uses her full concentration searching and analyzing the important materials of Lowell's poems that can help her to complete her study . Finally , the writer of this thesis admits that Lowell's poems are rich in details , emotions , expressions and imaqes io revealing the central ideas of the poems. She concludes her study by presenting a comparison of Lowell's poems , in order to help the readers see more clearly and understand better Lowell's goems
